alert.note: Alert for Carbon; Monroe (Pennsylvania) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly (New Jersey, Delaware, Southeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued July 12 at 4:34PM EDT until July 12 at 5:30PM EDT by NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly
info.description: The National Weather Service in Mount Holly NJ has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Carbon County in northeastern Pennsylvania... Western Monroe County in northeastern Pennsylvania... * Until 530 PM EDT. * At 433 PM EDT, a severe thunderstorm was located over Drifton, or near Hazleton, moving east at 40 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and quarter size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Minor damage to vehicles is possible. Wind damage to roofs, siding, trees, and power lines is possible. * Locations impacted include... Lehighton, Mount Pocono, Tobyhanna, Palmerton, Jim Thorpe, Nesquehoning, Weatherly, Brodheadsville, Kunkletown, Pocono Pines, Gilbert, Pocono Raceway, Lake Harmony, Tannersville, Mountainhome, Rossland, Long Pond, Albrightsville, Kresgeville and Sun Valley. This includes the following highways... Northeast Extension between mile markers 73 and 97. Interstate 80 in Pennsylvania between mile markers 277 and 305. Interstate 380 in Pennsylvania between mile markers 0 and 9. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.00 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.
